title: 114_hr3803
content: Section 304 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to allow for revisions or reaffirmations of the joint resolution on the budget for a fiscal year. The chairman of the Budget Committee may adjust levels as needed for enforcement. Additionally, there is a limitation on the content of budget resolutions. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON THE CONTENT OF BUDGET RESOLUTIONS. It shall not be in order in the House of Representatives or in the Senate to consider any joint resolution on the budget or any amendment thereto or conference report thereon that contains any matter not permitted in section 301 (a) or (b). SEC. 7. DEEMING OF BUDGETARY AGGREGATES, ALLOCATIONS, AND RECONCILIATION INSTRUCTIONS IN THE HOUSE AND SENATE UPON VETO OF JOINT RESOLUTION ON THE BUDGET. This section introduces an automatic standing order upon the veto of a joint resolution on the budget, making it enforceable within 15 days of enactment or presentment to the President. SEC. 8 introduces additional amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to implement joint resolutions on the budget. Additional amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 include changing "concurrent" to "joint" in various sections, replacing "concurrent resolution" with "joint resolution," and updating terminology from "agreed to" to "enacted." The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to change "concurrent" to "joint" in various sections and update terminology to "enacted." SEC. 9. AMENDMENTS TO THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES TO EFFECTUATE JOINT BUDGET RESOLUTIONS. Clauses of rule X, rule XVIII, and rule XX of the House of Representatives are amended to replace "concurrent" with "joint". SEC. 10. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS TO THE BALANCED BUDGET AND EMERGENCY DEFICIT CONTROL ACT OF 1985. Section 258C(b)(1) of the Act is amended to replace "concurrent" with "joint".
